summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Heaven's Lost Property - The Angeloid of Clockwork (Blu-ray/DVD Combo)
Review Date: 2014/09/20
Store: Brittany Karbowski  (Actor),     Greg Ayres  (Actor),     Christopher Bevins  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    NR    Format: Blu-ray
Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, Blu-ray, Anime
Product Description: ['Product Description', 'BR/DVD.', 'Amazon.com', 'Although the', "Heaven's Lost Property", 'feature', 'The Angeloid of Clockwork', "(2011) was released theatrically, it plays like a choppy series of OVA adventures cut together. Pretty high school student Hiyori Kazane nurtures a crush on Tomoki. She watches him with his friend Sohara and the Angeloids, but she's too shy to say anything to him. The first half of the movie echoes the original series: Tomoki and his friends go about their usual misadventures around town and at local festivals. The filmmakers include plenty of jiggle shots and underwear jokes. At one point, the girls' panties fly away like a swarm of butterflies, although the viewer never learns why. The last third of the film turns serious: apparently Hiyori is dreaming her everyday adventures while her body lies in the facility known as Synapse. When she's hit by a truck, Hiyori dies in her dream and reenters her real body. She wants to come back to Sorami so intensely, she returns as an Angeloid--to destroy Tomoki. The tragic romance plays oddly against the gross jokes. During much of the film, Tomoki is drawn as a sort of toy-avatar who argues with himself on the toilet and rides the conveyor belt in a sushi bar, naked on a plastic tray. Although", "Heaven's Lost Property", 'has proved popular on both sides of the Pacific,', 'otaku', "who watch it for the fan service shots probably won't enjoy the ill-starred romance, and romantics will be put off by the raw jokes. (Rated TV MA: risqué humor, toilet humor, nudity, cartoon violence, violence against women)", '--Charles Solomon']
Average Rating: 4.7
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Anime & Manga', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Blu-ray, Color, Widescreen, Animated', 'Contributor': 'Brittany Karbowski, Jamie Marchi, Christopher Bevins, Eric Vale, Greg Ayres', 'Language': 'Japanese, English', 'Number Of Discs': '2', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.77:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.47 Ounces', 'Item model number': '704400058837', 'Director': 'Christopher Bevins', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Blu-ray, Color, Widescreen, Animated', 'Run time': '1 hour and 35 minutes', 'Release date': 'February 26, 2013', 'Actors': 'Brittany Karbowski, Greg Ayres, Eric Vale, Jamie Marchi', 'Subtitles': 'English', 'Studio': 'Funimation Prod', 'Number of discs': '2'}
Review Text: This is probably the most funny and cutest anime me and my hubs have ever seen. It's packed with pervy stuff, cuteness, and humor. This anime will strike the heartstrings and make your sides hurt from laughing too hard. It's perfectly scripted and made- it's just too much perfection in one show. Daisuki!
Review Title: Sora no Otoshimono/Heaven's Lost Property...
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------

Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Aneesh Chaganty'], 'Producers': ['Timur Bekmambetov', 'Sev Ohanian', 'Natalie Qasabian', 'Adam Sidman'], 'Starring': ['John Cho', 'Debra Messing', 'Joseph Lee'], 'Studio': ['Screen Gems']}
Review Text: The second I saw the trailer for this in theaters, I was beyond excited to see it. I was not disappointed at all and can’t wait to watch it again. It’s one of those movies where you’ll be playing detective in your head and think you have the right answer only to become stumped the next minute and second guess yourself. I highly recommend giving this a watch, you won’t regret it!

Chester', 'Beau Ferris', 'Fredrik Heinig', 'Lars Knudsen', 'Pelle Nilsson', 'Jeffrey Penman'], 'Starring': ['Florence Pugh', 'Jack Reynor', 'William Jackson Harper'], 'Studio': ['A24 Distribution LLC']}
Review Text: I love this movie because it has every element a true horror film should have. Unsettling atmosphere, brow-shifting moments, creepy scenes that make you thankful for not having to experience them yourself, disturbing characters that make your skin crawl- you name it. I’m a horror fan and honestly I don’t do well with watching this alone, even in daylight. I highly recommend Midsommar to anyone who loves being weirded/freaked out or enjoys thought-provoking subjects. By the way, this is a movie that you need to actually watch from start to finish (as well as pay attention to the small details).. so set aside time, put down the phone, and prepare yourself for this bizarre ride!

Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Anthony Russo', 'Joe Russo'], 'Producers': ['Kevin Feige'], 'Starring': ['Robert Downey Jr.', 'Chris Evans', 'Mark Ruffalo'], 'Studio': ['Marvel']}
Review Text: I despise long movies (I get bored easily), but this is possibly the ONLY one I can watch over and over and over again and NEVER get tired or bored of. My boyfriend got me into the Marvel universe (I was always into X-men but he introduced me to these movies when we met) and I was amazed at how fast I fell in love with each and every single Marvel movie (except for Tom Holland’s Spiderman films because Andrew Garfield is KING). Endgame is perfect and beyond captivating. I’m sure it’s still be amazing for people who aren’t hardcore Marvel fans who skipped over Iron Man or Hulk or Thor or Avengers, but TRUST me when I say if you’re one of those people then you’re missing out on an incredible and thrilling journey. I can’t recommend this movie enough!!!
Review Title: Brilliant, intense, hilarious, and action-packed!
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------

Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Dennie Gordon'], 'Producers': ['Denise Di Novi', 'Robert Thorne', 'Mary-Kate Olsen', 'Ashley Olsen'], 'Starring': ['Mary-Kate Olsen', 'Ashley Olsen', 'Andy Richter'], 'Studio': ['Warner Bros.']}
Review Text: This is not a movie that anyone should take seriously or have high expectations for. It’s about two polar opposite twins who unwillingly get stuck together after many mishaps, learning about each other along the way and what it means to be sisters. The cast is awesome but there are some scenes that might cause some light cringing. Overall, it’s a funny story with some heavy moments and I truly enjoy putting this movie on from time to time when I need to chill and laugh. Did I mention Simple Plan is in it???
Review Title: Awkward acting, Simple Plan, and lots of humor!

Review Text: Being a gamer, I’m OBSESSED with Game Night. Max and Annie’s witty and loving nerdy relationship, Gary’s odd demeanor, Brooks’s cocky attitude, Sarah’s partnership with Ryan’s goofy, air headed yet intelligent self, Kevin’s comedically-charged curiosity with Michelle’s mystery celebrity hookup, and everything in between! Whenever anyone asks for my recommendation for a comedy, I direct them to this movie and they always come back to me telling me how funny it was and how they full on bought it! I can’t recommend this gem enough!!!

raw_response:
POSITIVE SUMMARY:
The user has expressed overwhelming enthusiasm for a variety of films, particularly enjoying a blend of humor, cuteness, and engaging storytelling. Several movies stood out for their comedic elements, with recommendations highlighting their fun and entertaining nature. Users appreciated films that elicit strong emotional responses, from laughter to heartfelt moments. The sentiment reflects a preference for captivating narratives that combine action and humor, often recommending these titles to others. The high ratings suggest a satisfaction with production quality and overall enjoyment.

NEGATIVE SUMMARY:
While the user generally has positive experiences, some reviews indicate moments of dissatisfaction. Certain films were described as being "too quirky" or lacking depth, resulting in a mixed emotional response. Others did not resonate as strongly, with comments suggesting they were merely "entertaining" rather than outstanding. The user has occasionally noted that specific movies felt disjointed or "all over the place," leading to reluctance in re-watching or purchasing those titles. The presence of violence and crude humor in some films also raised concerns for the viewer.

OVERALL SUMMARY:
The user's shopping behavior reveals a clear affinity for humor-laden films that evoke laughter and emotional engagement, with high ratings indicating overall satisfaction. However, there are instances of disappointment with films perceived as minor or lacking coherence. Despite some negative experiences, many purchases reflect a trend towards recommending enjoyable comedies and engaging narratives. The user balances both excitement and critical thought in their viewing choices, favoring quality storytelling that resonates with a fun experience.
